response:
Imaging must urgently confirm a right midbrain lesion and distinguish ischaemic, haemorrhagic, demyelinating or neoplastic aetiology to guide acute therapy. Vascular and cardiac studies evaluate for embolic or large-vessel causes if stroke is confirmed, while blood and CSF tests search for inflammatory, infectious or prothrombotic conditions.

investigations = ["Non-contrast CT brain", "CT angiogram of head and neck", "MRI brain with diffusion-weighted imaging and gadolinium contrast", "MR angiography of intracranial vessels", "ECG", "Continuous cardiac telemetry", "Transthoracic echocardiogram", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Coagulation screen", "Blood glucose", "HbA1c", "Fasting lipid profile", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "C-reactive protein", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, ANCA, antiphospholipid antibodies)", "Thrombophilia screen", "Vitamin B12 level", "Lumbar puncture with CSF analysis including cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands, cytology and cultures", "MRI of cervical and thoracic spine with gadolinium contrast", "Visual evoked potentials"]
